section.title: What is the difference between the application and the applet?
section.p: The Jmol application is a standalone program that you run on your system ... like RasMol.
The JmolApplet is an web browser applet that you embed in web pages that you author ... like Chime.

section.title: What platforms does the Jmol application run on?
section.p: The Jmol application should run on any system that supports Java 1.4. Previous versions of Java are not supported.

section.title: What browsers does the JmolApplet run on?
section.p:
The JmolApplet runs on most popular browsers, including
Win32
Microsoft IE 5.5+ (built-in Microsoft JVM or Sun Java Plug-in)
Netscape 4.76+
Mozilla 1.3+ with Sun Java Plug-in
MacOS 9
Netscape 4.78
MacOS X 10.3 (10.2 has no JavaScript support)
Safari
IE no JavaScript support
Netscape 7+
Linux/Unix
Netscape 4.76+
Mozilla 1.2.1+
Konqueror 3.1+ has some problems with multiple applets on the same page

section.title: What is the deal with MacOS X?
section.p: Only Mac OS X 10.3 and greater are supported. Internet Explorer on Mac OS X 10.3 is not supported.

You must run MacOS X 10.3 in order to have support for LiveConnect communication between JavaScript and Java. Previous versions of OSX did not support this. Even on 10.3, Internet Explorer does not support LiveConnect communications.
